summary:
The Security Council,
Recalling previous resolutions and statements on Liberia and West Africa,
Took note of reports from the UN Panel of Experts on Liberia,
Recognizing the link between exploitation of natural resources and conflict,
Recalling measures imposed under resolution 1521 (2003) to prevent conflict,
Expressing satisfaction with UNMIL's deployment, but concern about former President Taylor's activities,
Reviewed measures imposed by resolution 1521 (2003) and progress towards objectives,
Welcoming steps by the National Transitional Government of Liberia,
Noting challenges in reintegration, repatriation, and security sector restructuring,
Concerned about limited progress in establishing authority and control over timber-producing areas,
Welcoming preparations for a Certificate of Origin regime for rough diamonds,
Determining the situation in Liberia remains a threat to international peace and security,
Acting under Chapter VII of the Charter,
Decides to:
- Renew measures on arms and travel for 12 months,
- Renew measures on timber for 12 months,
- Renew measures on diamonds for 6 months, reviewable after 3 months,
Reiterates readiness to terminate measures when conditions are met,
Encourages the National Transitional Government of Liberia to intensify efforts to meet conditions.
The Security Council:
 
3. Urges the National Transitional Government to support the Initiative and necessary reforms in the Forestry Development Authority for the benefit of the Liberian people;

4. Notes measures imposed by resolution 1532 (2004) to prevent former President Charles Taylor, his family, and close allies from using misappropriated funds and property to interfere in peace and stability in Liberia and the subregion, and will review these measures annually;

5. Calls on the international donor community to assist the peace process, contribute to humanitarian appeals, disburse pledges made at the Liberia Reconstruction Conference, and respond to the financial, administrative, and technical needs of the National Transitional Government;

6. Demands all States refrain from actions that might destabilize the subregion and take action to prevent armed individuals and groups from using their territory to prepare and commit attacks on neighboring countries;

7. Reminds States of their obligation to implement measures under resolutions 1521 (2003) and 1532 (2004), particularly freezing assets of persons designated by the Committee;
